eg.projects

Class AbstractProject

  • java.lang.Object
    • eg.projects.AbstractProject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Configurable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GenericProject, HtmlProject, JavaProject, PerlProject, RProject

    public abstract class AbstractProject
extends java.lang.Object
implements Configurable
    The configuration of a project.

    This class works in combination with an object of SettingsWindow where values required for a configuration are entered.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected SettingsWindow.InputOptionsBuilder inputOptions
      The object of InputOptionsBuilder which a project uses to build the content of this SettingsWindow

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractProject

        protected AbstractProject(ProjectTypes projType,
                          boolean useProjectFile,
                          java.lang.String sourceExtension)
        Parameters:
        projType - the project type which has a valaue in ProjectTypes
        useProjectFile - the boolean value that is true to indicate that the project uses a main project file
        sourceExtension - the extension of source files (or of the main file if extensions differ). Null if no main project file is used

        Description copied from interface: Configurable
        Configures a project based on the entries in this settings window and the specified directory
        Specified by:
        configureProject in interface Configurable
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory that may be or be contained in the presumed root directory of the project
        Returns:
        the boolean value that is true if the project could be configured

      • retrieveProject

        public final boolean retrieveProject(java.lang.String dir)
        Retrieves a project stored in a preferences file based on the specified directory.

        First it is tried to find a "ProjConfig" file in dir or further upward the directory path and, if this is not found, it is tested if dir is contained in the recent project saved in the "Prefs" file in the program folder.

        Specified by:
        retrieveProject in interface Configurable
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory that may be or be contained in the presumed root directory of the project
        Returns:
        the boolean value that is true if a saved project could be retrieved

      • getExecutableDirName

        public final java.lang.String getExecutableDirName()
        Returns the name of the directory where executable files are saved.

        The directory does not have to exist, even if its name is specified in this SettingsWindow, for a successful project configuration.

        Specified by:
        getExecutableDirName in interface Configurable
        Returns:
        the name

      • getNamespace

        protected java.lang.String getNamespace()
        Returns the namespace of the main file. This is a relative directory or directory path based at the sources directory or, if a sources directory is not given, at the project's root directory.
        Returns:
        the namespace. The empty string if no namespace is given

      • getSourceDirName

        protected java.lang.String getSourceDirName()
        Returns the name of the directoy where source files are saved
        Returns:
        the name. The empty string if no source directory is given

        protected java.lang.String getSourceExtension()

        Returns:
        the extension. Null if no source extension is given

      • mainExecFileExists

        protected boolean mainExecFileExists(java.lang.String ext)
        Returns if the main executable file exists. The file is searched in the executables directory if it is specified or in the project root directory
        Parameters:
        ext - the extension of the executable file (with starting period)
        Returns:
        the boolean value that is true if the file exists
